$eref.description: Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine Extension.
Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine Scale Set.

___overprovision.description: Specifies whether the Virtual Machine Scale Set should be overprovisioned.

$eref.description: Describes a virtual machine scale set sku.

___sku.description: the virtual machine scale set sku.

$eref.description: The instance view of a resource.

___virtualMachines.description: a list containing reference to all Virtual Machines created under this Availability Set.

$eref.description: Plan for the resource.

___plan.description: the purchase plan when deploying virtual machine from VM Marketplace images.

$eref.description: Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine.

___licenseType.description: the license type, which is for bring your own license scenario.

___availabilitySet.description: the reference Id of the availability set to which this virtual machine belongs.

$eref.description: Microsoft.Compute/virtualMachines/extensions

_88VirtualMachineScaleSetStorageProfile.description: Describes a virtual machine scale set storage profile.

$eref.description: Describes a virtual machine scale set operating system disk.

___image.description: the Source User Image VirtualHardDisk. This VirtualHardDisk will be copied before using it to attach to the Virtual Machine. If SourceImage is provided, the destination VirtualHardDisk should not exist.

___vhdContainers.description: the list of virtual hard disk container uris.

$eref.description: The image reference.

___version.description: the image version. The allowed formats are Major.Minor.Build or 'latest'. Major, Minor and Build being decimal numbers. Specify 'latest' to use the latest version of image.

$eref.description: Describes a Encryption Settings for a Disk

___diskEncryptionKey.description: the disk encryption key which is a KeyVault Secret.

___keyEncryptionKey.description: the key encryption key which is KeyVault Key.

___enabled.description: whether disk encryption should be enabled on the Virtual Machine.

$eref.description: Describes the uri of a disk.

___uri.description: the virtual hard disk's uri. It should be a valid Uri to a virtual hard disk.

___diskSizeGB.description: the initial disk size in GB for blank data disks, and the new desired size for existing OS and Data disks.

$eref.description: Describes the uri of a disk.

___uri.description: the virtual hard disk's uri. It should be a valid Uri to a virtual hard disk.

___image.description: the Source User Image VirtualHardDisk. This VirtualHardDisk will be copied before using it to attach to the Virtual Machine. If SourceImage is provided, the destination VirtualHardDisk should not exist.

_88DiskEncryptionSettings.description: Describes a Encryption Settings for a Disk

$eref.description: Describes a reference to Key Vault Secret

___secretUrl.description: the URL referencing a secret in a Key Vault.

___sourceVault.description: the Relative URL of the Key Vault containing the secret.

___diskEncryptionKey.description: the disk encryption key which is a KeyVault Secret.

$eref.description: Describes a reference to Key Vault Key

___keyUrl.description: the URL referencing a key in a Key Vault.

___sourceVault.description: the Relative URL of the Key Vault containing the key

___keyEncryptionKey.description: the key encryption key which is KeyVault Key.

___enabled.description: whether disk encryption should be enabled on the Virtual Machine.

_88VaultSecretGroup.description: Describes a set of certificates which are all in the same Key Vault.

$eref.description: Describes a single certificate reference in a Key Vault, and where the certificate should reside on the VM.

___certificateStore.description: the Certificate store in LocalMachine to add the certificate to on Windows, leave empty on Linux.

___certificateUrl.description: the URL referencing a secret in a Key Vault which contains a properly formatted certificate.

___vaultCertificates.description: the list of key vault references in SourceVault which contain certificates

___sourceVault.description: the Relative URL of the Key Vault containing all of the certificates in VaultCertificates.

_88WinRMListener.description: Describes Protocol and thumbprint of Windows Remote Management listener

___protocol.description: the Protocol used by WinRM listener. Currently only Http and Https are supported.

___certificateUrl.description: the Certificate URL in KMS for Https listeners. Should be null for Http listeners.

$eref.description: Describes Windows Configuration of the OS Profile.

___disablePasswordAuthentication.description: whether Authentication using user name and password is allowed or not

___ssh.description: the SSH configuration for linux VMs

___linuxConfiguration.description: the Linux Configuration of the OS profile.

$eref.description: Describes a set of certificates which are all in the same Key Vault.

___vaultCertificates.description: the list of key vault references in SourceVault which contain certificates

___sourceVault.description: the Relative URL of the Key Vault containing all of the certificates in VaultCertificates.

___secrets.description: the List of certificates for addition to the VM.

___customData.description: a base-64 encoded string of custom data.

$eref.description: Describes Windows Configuration of the OS Profile.

___winRM.description: the Windows Remote Management configuration of the VM

___additionalUnattendContent.description: the additional base-64 encoded XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file.

___enableAutomaticUpdates.description: whether Windows updates are automatically installed on the VM

___provisionVMAgent.description: whether VM Agent should be provisioned on the Virtual Machine.

___timeZone.description: the Time Zone of the VM

___windowsConfiguration.description: the Windows Configuration of the OS profile.

_88VirtualMachineScaleSetIPConfiguration.description: Describes a virtual machine scale set network profile's IP configuration properties.

___applicationGatewayBackendAddressPools.description: the application gateway backend address pools.

___loadBalancerInboundNatPools.description: the load balancer inbound nat pools.

___loadBalancerBackendAddressPools.description: the load balancer backend address pools.

___id.description: the ARM resource id in the form of /subscriptions/{SubcriptionId}/resourceGroups/{ResourceGroupName}/...

_88VirtualMachineScaleSetExtensionProper.description: Describes the properties of a Virtual Machine Scale Set Extension.

___type.description: the type of the extension handler.

___settings.description: Json formatted public settings for the extension.

___typeHandlerVersion.description: the type version of the extension handler.

___protectedSettings.description: Json formatted protected settings for the extension.

___publisher.description: the name of the extension handler publisher.

___autoUpgradeMinorVersion.description: whether the extension handler should be automatically upgraded across minor versions.

___uri.description: the virtual hard disk's uri. It should be a valid Uri to a virtual hard disk.

_88SshConfiguration.description: SSH configuration for Linux based VMs running on Azure

$eref.description: Contains information about SSH certificate public key and the path on the Linux VM where the public key is placed.

___keyData.description: Certificate public key used to authenticate with VM through SSH. The certificate must be in Pem format with or without headers.

___path.description: the full path on the created VM where SSH public key is stored. If the file already exists, the specified key is appended to the file.

___publicKeys.description: the list of SSH public keys used to authenticate with linux based VMs

_88VaultCertificate.description: Describes a single certificate reference in a Key Vault, and where the certificate should reside on the VM.

___certificateStore.description: the Certificate store in LocalMachine to add the certificate to on Windows, leave empty on Linux.

_88AdditionalUnattendContent.description: additional XML formatted information that can be included in the Unattend.xml file, which is used by Windows Setup. Contents are defined by setting name, component name, and the pass in which the content is a applied.

___passName.description: the pass name. Currently, the only allowable value is oobeSystem.

___componentName.description: the component name. Currently, the only allowable value is Microsoft-Windows-Shell-Setup.

___content.description: XML formatted content that is added to the unattend.xml file in the specified pass and component. The XML must be less than 4 KB and must include the root element for the setting or feature that is being inserted.
